sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies Ltd.'s (NASDAQ:INVZ) Share Price Is Still Matching Investor Opinion Despite 25% Slump
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (NASDAQ:INVZ) has experienced a 25% share price drop in the last month and a 47% decline over the past year, yet its high price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 4.1x suggests investor optimism. Despite the recent slump, the company's strong revenue growth of 46% last year and a projected 74% annual growth over the next three years, compared to the industry's 14%, support its high valuation. This indicates that shareholders remain confident in the company's future revenue potential, which is propping up the P/S ratio.

feed.title: Innoviz launches InnovizThree LiDAR for flexible integration
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. has launched its new LiDAR, InnovizThree, which offers slimmer dimensions, lower power consumption, and higher performance at a reduced price compared to its predecessor, InnovizTwo. This updated design facilitates flexible integration behind the windshield or on the rooftop, providing automakers with more design options. The InnovizThree boasts a lighter 600-gram body, detection beyond 250 meters, and a 13W low-power mode, making it suitable for automotive and AI-enabled platforms like humanoids, micro robotics, and drones.

feed.title: Innoviz unveils next-gen LiDAR sensor for safer autonomous driving
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies has launched InnovizThree, a smaller and lighter automotive-grade LiDAR sensor designed to accelerate autonomous driving adoption. This new sensor, weighing 600 grams and costing 35% less than its predecessor, offers high performance with reduced power consumption and strong long-range detection beyond 250 meters. Its compact design makes it suitable for various applications, including robotics and drones, and will be showcased at CES 2026.

feed.title: Can Innoviz (INVZ) Turn Cheaper, Slimmer LiDAR Into Lasting Autonomy Scale Advantages?
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies launched its InnovizThree LiDAR, a slimmer and more cost-effective sensor with extended detection ranges, targeting diverse applications from automotive to AI-enabled platforms like humanoids and drones. The company will showcase this new product at CES 2026 to broaden OEM engagement and highlight its potential beyond passenger vehicles. This launch aims to strengthen Innoviz's investment narrative by demonstrating how its LiDAR design could enhance autonomous systems, despite ongoing losses and reliance on NRE income.

feed.title: Innoviz unveils smaller, cheaper lidar sensor for automotive use
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. has launched its new InnovizThree LiDAR sensor, which is smaller, lighter, and over 35% cheaper than its predecessor, maintaining a detection range beyond 250 meters. Designed for automotive integration, the sensor also has applications in robotics and drones. Innoviz plans to showcase the product at CES 2026, positioning itself as a key supplier for autonomous vehicle technology.

feed.title: INVZ - Innoviz Technologies Ltd Latest Stock News & Market Updates
feed.summary: This page serves as a comprehensive resource for the latest news and market updates concerning Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (INVZ), a company specializing in LiDAR solutions for autonomous vehicles. It aggregates corporate announcements, financial results, strategic partnerships, and technological advancements, including the recent unveiling of InnovizThree and collaborations with major automotive OEMs. The content aims to keep investors and industry professionals informed about INVZ's progress in advancing perception systems for autonomous navigation.

feed.title: Stock Traders Purchase High Volume of Innoviz Technologies Put Options (NASDAQ:INVZ)
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies (NASDAQ:INVZ) saw an unusually high volume of put options traded, specifically 19,153 contracts, representing a 356% increase over typical daily volume. This surge in put options activity suggests increased bearish sentiment among some traders, even as institutional investors like Polar Asset Management and Goldman Sachs have either increased or maintained significant stakes in the company, and analysts generally rate it a "Moderate Buy" with an average target price of $3.10. The stock has been trading near its 52-week low amidst these conflicting signals.

feed.title: Innoviz unveils smaller, cheaper lidar sensor for automotive use By Investing.com
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (NASDAQ:INVZ) has introduced its new InnovizThree LiDAR sensor, which is smaller, lighter, and over 35% cheaper than its predecessor, the InnovizTwo. This sensor is designed for easier integration into vehicles, including behind-windshield mounting, while maintaining strong detection capabilities. Innoviz plans to demonstrate the InnovizThree at CES 2026 and continues to position itself as a key supplier of LiDAR technology for autonomous vehicles amidst recent financial and partnership successes.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies Unveils InnovizThree, a Quantum Leap in Innoviz's LiDAR Solutions
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies has launched InnovizThree, their latest LiDAR solution, designed to be slimmer, more power-efficient, and significantly cheaper than its predecessor, InnovizTwo. This new model offers enhanced performance and flexibility for integration into automotive and AI-enhanced platforms like humanoids and drones. InnovizThree will be publicly demonstrated for the first time at CES 2026.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies (NasdaqCM:INVZ): Revisiting Valuation After New LiDAR and NVIDIA Edge AI Showcase Plans
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies (NasdaqCM:INVZ) is gaining investor attention following its announcement to showcase new LiDAR technology at CES 2026, despite recent stock price volatility. While a narrative fair value suggests the stock is undervalued at $2.65, its high price-to-sales ratio indicates potential valuation risks. The company is actively expanding into non-automotive markets and analysts see upside, but execution risk remains significant.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies (NASDAQ:INVZ) Lowered to "Sell" Rating by Wall Street Zen
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies (NASDAQ:INVZ) has been downgraded to a "sell" rating by Wall Street Zen, while Weiss Ratings also maintains a "sell (d-)." Goldman Sachs, however, kept a "buy" rating with a trimmed price target of $2.00. The company, which develops LiDAR sensors and perception software for autonomous driving, currently has a MarketBeat consensus of "Moderate Buy" with an average price target of $3.10 despite its current loss-making status.

feed.title: [News] Innoviz Technologies at CES 2026: Showcasing the Future of Autonomous Mobility with Advanced LiDAR Solutions
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies will showcase its advanced LiDAR solutions at CES 2026, including the debut of its new InnovizThree, along with InnovizTwo and InnovizSMART platforms. The company aims to demonstrate its commitment to delivering best-in-class LiDAR for autonomous driving and smart applications, highlighting features like behind-the-windshield placement and blockage solutions. Visitors can experience live product demonstrations and pre-scheduled test drives of their technology.

feed.title: We Think Innoviz Technologies (NASDAQ:INVZ) Needs To Drive Business Growth Carefully
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies (NASDAQ:INVZ) is a company that has yet to make a profit, burning through US$61m last year with a cash runway of about 15 months. While its operating revenue grew by 46% and cash burn reduced by 21%, the significant cash burn relative to its market capitalization (24%) raises concerns about potential shareholder dilution if more capital is needed. Despite this, the revenue growth provides some reassurance for the company's financial situation.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies at CES 2026: Showcasing the Future of Autonomous Mobility with Advanced LiDAR Solutions
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies announced its participation in CES 2026, where it will debut its new InnovizThree LiDAR alongside its InnovizTwo platform and InnovizSMART sensor. The company will showcase advanced LiDAR solutions for autonomous driving and smart applications, emphasizing safety and performance. This participation follows a recent partnership with Daimler Truck and Torc Robotics, highlighting Innoviz's commitment to delivering best-in-class LiDAR technology.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies Concludes Annual Shareholder Meeting with Key Governance Resolutions
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies held its annual general meeting on December 16, 2025, where shareholders approved key governance resolutions including the re-election of directors, readoption of compensation policies, and appointment of auditors. These decisions aim to strengthen the company's governance, compensation alignment, and operational oversight within the autonomous technology sector. While Innoviz shows strong revenue growth and strategic achievements, profitability and cash flow remain significant challenges according to TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark.

feed.title: Daimler Truck To Deploy Autonomous Freight Vehicles
feed.summary: Daimler Truck is advancing towards commercial deployment of autonomous freight vehicles by partnering with Innoviz Technologies Ltd. Innoviz will supply its InnovizTwo short-range LiDAR sensors for Daimler Truck's SAE Level 4 autonomous semi-trucks, which will be integrated into autonomous Freightliner Cascadias with Torc Robotics' virtual driver system. The initiative aims to enhance operational efficiency and road safety on North American highways and regional routes.

feed.title: Daimler Truck and Torc Robotics Select Innoviz Technologies as LiDAR Partner for Series Production of Level 4 Autonomous Trucks
feed.summary: Daimler Truck and its subsidiary, Torc Robotics, have selected Innoviz Technologies as the LiDAR supplier for their series production of SAE Level 4 autonomous Class 8 semi-trucks, confirming Innoviz's previously undisclosed commercial OEM partnership. Innoviz will provide its InnovizTwo Short-Range LiDAR sensors for integration into autonomous Freightliner Cascadia trucks, enhancing the virtual driver system for deployment across North American highway and regional routes. This collaboration is a significant validation of Innoviz's technology and positions it as a critical component in Daimler Truck's strategy to bring autonomous trucks to market.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (INVZ) Reports Q3 Loss, Misses Revenue Estimates
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (INVZ) has reported a Q3 loss, failing to meet revenue estimates. The lidar technology company's financial performance in the third quarter fell short of expectations.

feed.title: Daimler Truck and Torc Robotics Select Innoviz Technologies as LiDAR Partner for Series Production of Level 4 Autonomous Trucks
feed.summary: Daimler Truck and Torc Robotics have chosen Innoviz Technologies as their short-range LiDAR supplier for the series production of SAE Level 4 autonomous Class 8 semi-trucks. This partnership will integrate InnovizTwo Short-Range LiDAR sensors into the autonomous Freightliner Cascadia, combined with Torc’s virtual driver, to enhance road safety and operational efficiency for fleet operators. The collaboration is a critical step in Daimler Truck's strategy to bring autonomous trucks to market, focusing on deployment across North American highway and regional routes.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies (NASDAQ: INVZ) to supply LiDAR for Daimler Level 4 trucks
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies (NASDAQ: INVZ) has been selected by Daimler Truck and Torc Robotics as the Short-Range LiDAR supplier for the series production of SAE Level 4 autonomous Class 8 semi-trucks. Innoviz will provide its InnovizTwo Short-Range LiDAR sensors and collaborate on integration into the autonomous Freightliner Cascadia for deployment across North American highway and regional routes. This partnership validates Innoviz's technology and strengthens its position in the autonomous trucking market, aiming to enhance operational efficiency and road safety.

feed.title: Daimler Truck & Innoviz: Autonomy Tech Partnership
feed.summary: Daimler Truck and Torc Robotics have partnered with Innoviz Technologies Ltd. to use its InnovizTwo Short-Range LiDAR sensors for their SAE Level 4 autonomous Class 8 trucks. This collaboration aims to advance sensor technology for commercial trucking applications, integrating Innoviz's LiDAR into Freightliner Cascadia trucks to enhance operational efficiency and road safety. The initiative underscores the industry's focus on multi-layered sensor systems for reliable autonomous vehicle operation.

feed.title: Daimler Truck and Torc Robotics Select Innoviz Technologies as LiDAR Partner for Series Production of Level 4 Autonomous Trucks
feed.summary: Daimler Truck and its subsidiary Torc Robotics have chosen Innoviz Technologies as their short-range LiDAR supplier for the series production of SAE Level 4 autonomous Class 8 semi-trucks. This partnership will integrate InnovizTwo LiDAR sensors into autonomous Freightliner Cascadias to enhance road safety and operational efficiency for fleet operators in North America. The collaboration underscores Innoviz's role as a leading LiDAR provider in the autonomous trucking market.

feed.title: A Look at Innoviz Technologies (NasdaqCM:INVZ) Valuation Following Major Automotive Deals and New LiDAR Launch - simplywall.st
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies is gaining investor interest due to major automotive deals, a new LiDAR launch, and lab accreditation, which has led to a significant 205.8% shareholder return over the past year. Despite this momentum, the company's stock is considered 20% undervalued with a fair value of $2.90, driven by expected demand acceleration for LiDAR solutions in autonomous vehicles. However, sustained profitability faces challenges from unpredictable revenue and competition from emerging sensor technologies.

feed.title: Why Investors Shouldn't Be Surprised By Innoviz Technologies Ltd.'s (NASDAQ:INVZ) 29% Share Price Surge - simplywall.st
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies (NASDAQ:INVZ) has seen a significant 29% share price surge in the last month, contributing to a 219% increase over the past year. Despite its high P/S ratio of 12.7x compared to the industry average of 2.8x, the company's strong revenue growth of 17% last year and a forecasted 128% annual growth for the next three years (compared to the industry's 14%) justifies the elevated valuation. Investors are confident in the company's future revenue prospects, which continues to support the stock price.

feed.title: Capital Advisors Inc. OK Takes Position in Innoviz Technologies Ltd. $INVZ
feed.summary: Capital Advisors Inc. OK has acquired a new stake in Innoviz Technologies Ltd., purchasing 125,000 shares valued at approximately $205,000. Innoviz Technologies has received mixed analyst ratings, with a "Hold" consensus and an average price target of $3.27, despite missing earnings expectations for the most recent quarter. Institutional investors own 63.26% of the company's stock, with several firms recently increasing their positions.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies Enhances its Automotive Tier-1 Supplier Position by Achieving Key Certification for LiDAR Testing Laboratories
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. has achieved ISO/IEC 17025:2017 certification for its LiDAR testing laboratories, solidifying its position as an automotive Tier-1 supplier. This international accreditation validates the competence of its in-house testing capabilities, allowing for faster product development and time to market for customers. The certification confirms Innoviz's robust quality management systems and technical proficiency in comprehensive hardware qualification testing.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (INVZ) Reports Q2 Loss, Misses Revenue Estimates
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (INVZ) reported a Q2 loss of $0.09 per share, missing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of a $0.08 loss. The company also reported revenues of $9.75 million, falling short of consensus estimates by 19.38%. Innoviz Technologies shares have gained 8.3% year-to-date, underperforming the S&P 500.

feed.title: Major Breakthrough: Top 5 Global Automaker Selects Innoviz LiDAR for Mass-Market Autonomous Cars
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies (NASDAQ: INVZ) has secured a Statement of Development Work agreement with a Top 5 global automotive manufacturer to supply InnovizTwo LiDAR units for a Level 3 autonomous vehicle program, targeting mass-market production by 2027. This partnership validates Innoviz's technology and strengthens its position as a key supplier for autonomous driving solutions, with initial LiDAR deliveries scheduled for Q2 2025 to support data collection and development. While a major step, the current agreement is for development, and a final series production agreement is yet to be secured.

feed.title: Is Innoviz Technologies’ Stock Ready for a Massive Leap?
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (NASDAQ: INVZ) saw its stock rise by 10.46% following a new automotive partnership with Mobileye and an $80M NRE payment deal, indicating a strong outlook in the LiDAR sector. Rosenblatt upgraded the stock to a "Buy" rating as Innoviz targets full-fledged production by 2026, strengthening its financial position and market share prospects. Despite past financial challenges and a negative pre-tax profit margin, the robust balance sheet and strategic moves suggest significant growth potential as autonomous vehicles become mainstream.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies Gears Up for CES 2025: Showcasing the Future of Automotive LiDAR with Global OEM Leaders
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies will participate in CES 2025, showcasing its LiDAR technology, including the InnovizOne and InnovizTwo, integrated into leading OEM vehicles like the BMW i7 and Volkswagen ID. Buzz. The company will offer live demonstrations and test drives of its LiDAR solutions, emphasizing their role in advancing autonomous driving and vehicle safety. Innoviz's presence highlights its leadership as a Tier-1 supplier of high-performance, automotive-grade LiDAR sensors and perception software.

feed.title: Mobileye Partners with Innoviz for Next-Gen Autonomous Driving Tech, Major Automakers Already On Board
feed.summary: Mobileye and Innoviz Technologies have partnered for Mobileye to integrate Innoviz's LiDARs into its Mobileye Drive™ autonomous vehicle platform, with production scheduled for 2026. Major automakers like VW Commercial Vehicles and Schaeffler/VDL have already adopted the platform. This collaboration aims to enhance L4 autonomous driving capabilities by combining Innoviz's LiDAR technology with Mobileye's existing imaging radars and high-resolution cameras, leading to safer and more efficient autonomous transportation.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies and Major OEM Collaborate on New Short-Range LiDAR for L4 Autonomous Vehicles
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies announced a collaboration with a major automotive OEM to integrate new short-range LiDARs into the OEM's Level 4 autonomous driving platform. This agreement positions Innoviz for a series production nomination and aims to enhance safe and powerful autonomous driving experiences, particularly in the growing L4 market for various vehicle types. The new short-range LiDAR leverages the InnovizTwo Long-Range architecture, designed for high-resolution detection and a wide vertical field of view to meet stringent OEM requirements.

feed.title: INNOVIZ TECHNOLOGIES LTD. (NASDAQ: INVZ) DEADLINE ALERT: Bernstein Liebhard LLP Reminds Investors of the Deadline to File a Lead Plaintiff Motion in a Securities Class Action Lawsuit Against Innoviz Technologies Ltd.
feed.summary: Bernstein Liebhard LLP reminds investors of the May 14, 2024 deadline to file a lead plaintiff motion in a securities class action lawsuit against Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (NASDAQ: INVZ). The lawsuit alleges that Innoviz overstated the benefits of its partnerships and its profitability, leading to disappointing financial results for FY 2022 and a significant drop in stock price. Investors who purchased shares between April 21, 2021, and February 28, 2023, are encouraged to contact the firm.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (NASDAQ:INVZ) most popular amongst individual investors who own 34% of the shares, institutions hold 30%
feed.summary: Individual investors are the largest shareholder group in Innoviz Technologies Ltd. (NASDAQ:INVZ), owning 34% of the shares, followed by institutions with 30%. Hedge funds hold 13% and insiders own US$58 million worth of stock in the US$729 million company. No single shareholder holds a majority, with the top 15 shareholders combining for 50%.

feed.title: Israel’s Innoviz secures $4b deal to supply Volkswagen with LiDAR sensors
feed.summary: Israel’s Innoviz Technologies has secured a $4 billion deal to supply LiDAR sensors and perception software to Volkswagen's autonomous vehicle unit, CARIAD. The Israeli company expects to provide 5-8 million LiDAR units across multiple Volkswagen Group brands over an eight-year period, starting in 2025. This contract follows Innoviz's existing deals with BMW and Samsung Electronics' Harman International Industries.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies and Joowon Industrial Sign Distribution Agreement to Accelerate Development of LiDAR in the South Korean Market
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies and Joowon Industrial have signed a distribution agreement to accelerate the adoption of LiDAR in the South Korean market. Joowon Industrial will integrate Innoviz's LiDAR technology into its TADS system for automated power distribution line inspection, anticipating significant cost reduction and quality improvement. This partnership aims to establish a strong presence for Innoviz's LiDAR solutions across various industrial applications in Korea and potentially globally.

feed.title: Innoviz Bolsters Sales Leadership with New Management Team Appointments
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies announced new management team appointments to strengthen its sales leadership and support growth. Tali Chen was named Chief Business Officer, while Scott Craig and Brijesh Shukla were appointed as Country Managers for the U.S. and Japan, respectively. These appointments aim to capitalize on the company's growth opportunities in automotive and non-automotive sectors.

feed.title: Innoviz LiDAR Pilot Launched to Enhance Twinner Vehicle Inspection Scanning Capabilities
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies announced a collaboration with Twinner, a German vehicle scanner provider, to integrate its InnovizOne LiDAR into Twinner's Digital Twinn® platform. This pilot aims to enhance the accuracy and detail of vehicle inspections by providing high-quality 360-degree views and 3D information, enabling better assessment of vehicle conditions for remarketing and sales. The partnership seeks to bring greater transparency and trust to digital transactions in the automotive industry, capitalizing on the growing online car-buying market.

feed.title: Japan's Largest Construction Company, Obayashi, Selects Innoviz's LiDAR for its New Proprietary Automatic Tower Crane System
feed.summary: Obayashi Corporation, Japan's largest construction company, has developed an automatic tower crane system utilizing Innoviz's LiDAR sensors. This system aims to replace manual crane operation, enhancing safety and efficiency on construction sites. Innoviz's LiDAR provides precise object distance measurement and identification of people and equipment, contributing to substantial savings in manual operation costs.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies' First InnovizTwo LiDAR to be Presented at CES® 2022 According to Plan
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies announced the successful launch of the first B samples of its automotive-grade InnovizTwo LiDAR sensor, which will be showcased for the first time at CES 2022. The InnovizTwo offers a 30x performance improvement over its predecessor at a 70 percent cost reduction, targeting the consumer car market for Level 3 autonomy. The company projects the Total Addressable Market for InnovizTwo to reach over $20 billion by 2025 and $55 billion by 2030.

feed.title: Innoviz Perception Solution Supported on NVIDIA DRIVE Platform
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies announced that its advanced perception solution is now supported on the NVIDIA DRIVE platform, integrating its LiDAR sensor and perception software into NVIDIA's end-to-end AI platform for autonomous vehicles. This collaboration allows Innoviz's technology to enable object detection, tracking, and classification, as well as obstacle detection and calibration, and is integrated with NVIDIA DRIVE Sim for development and validation. The partnership aims to accelerate the development and deployment of autonomous vehicles by providing customer access to Innoviz's LiDAR solutions within the NVIDIA DRIVE ecosystem.

feed.title: Innoviz Expands Board of Directors with Global Technology and Automotive Industry Veterans
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies Ltd. announced the appointment of new board members, including industry veterans Amichai Steimberg, Aharon Aharon, Dan Falk, Ronit Maor, Orit Stav, and James Sheridan, following its merger with Collective Growth Corporation. These additions bring extensive experience from the technology and automotive sectors, aiming to support the global deployment of Innoviz's automotive-grade LiDAR products and accelerate autonomous vehicle adoption. The expanded board will guide Innoviz in its transition to a public company and drive shareholder value, with a focus on high-volume series production for autonomous vehicles.

feed.title: Innoviz Technologies and Collective Growth Corporation Announce Closing of Business Combination
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies and Collective Growth Corporation have completed their business combination, with the combined entity retaining the Innoviz Technologies name and set to trade on Nasdaq under "INVZ." The transaction provides Innoviz with approximately $371 million in gross proceeds, positioning the company to expand its product roadmap and capitalize on the growing demand for LiDAR technology in the automotive industry. Innoviz plans to accelerate the mass production of InnovizOne for BMW and other customers, while also introducing the new generation InnovizTwo LiDAR.
